title: nodejs/http2: Working on an HTTP/2 Implementation for Node.js Core
author: guifortaine
content: readme.md node.js is javascript runtime built chrome's v8 javascript engine. node.jsuses event-driven, non-blocking /o model makes lightweight efficient. node.js package ecosystem, npm, is largest ecosystem open source libraries the world. node.js project is supported thenode.js foundation. contributions,policies, releases are managed under open governance model. project is bound a code conduct. you need help using installing node.js, please thenodejs/help issue tracker.table contentsresources newcomersrelease typesdownloadcurrent lts releasesnightly releasesapi documentationverifying binariesbuilding node.jssecuritycurrent project team membersctc (core technical committee)collaboratorsrelease teamresources newcomersofficial resourceswebsitenode.js helpcontributing the projectirc (node core development): #node-dev chat.freenode.netunofficial resourcesirc (general questions): #node.js chat.freenode.net. please http://nodeirc.info/ more information regarding #node.js ircchannel.please note unofficial resources are neither managed (nor necessarilyendorsed ) the node.js tsc/ctc. specifically, such resources are currently covered the node.js moderation policy the selection actions resource operators/moderators are subject tsc/ctc oversight.release types node.js project maintains multiple types releases:current: released active development branches this repository,versioned semver signed a member therelease team.code current releases is organized this repository major versionnumber. example: v4.x. major version number current releases increment every 6 monthsallowing breaking changes be introduced. happens april october every . current release lines beginning october each have maximum support life 8 months. current release lines beginning aprileach will convert lts ( below) 6 months receive furthersupport 30 months.lts: releases receive long-term support, a focus stability security. every second current release line (major version) become lts line receive 18 months active lts support a further 12months maintenance. lts release lines are given alphabeticallyordered codenames, beginning v4 argon. lts releases are less frequent will attempt maintain consistent major minor version numbers, incrementing patch version numbers. are breaking changes feature additions, except some special circumstances. more information be found the lts readme.nightly: versions code this repository the current currentbranch, automatically built every 24-hours where changes exist. withcaution.downloadbinaries, installers, source tarballs are available https://nodejs.org.current lts releasescurrent lts releases are available https://nodejs.org/download/release/, listed under version strings. latest directory is alias the latest current release. latest lts release an ltsline is available the form: latest-codename. example:https://nodejs.org/download/release/latest-argonnightly releasesnightly builds are available https://nodejs.org/download/nightly/, listed under versionstring includes date ( utc ) and commit sha the head the release.api documentationapi documentation is available each release nightlydirectory under docs. https://nodejs.org/api/ points the apidocumentation the latest stable version.verifying binariescurrent, lts nightly download directories contain shasum256.txtfile lists sha checksums each file available download. shasum256.txt be downloaded using curl.$ curl -o https://nodejs.org/dist/vx.y.z/shasums256.txt check a downloaded file matches checksum, run through sha256sum a command such :$ grep node-vx.y.z.tar.gz shasums256.txt | sha256sum -c -(where "node-vx.y.z.tar.gz" is name the file havedownloaded)additionally, current lts releases ( nightlies) gpg signedcopies shasum256.txt files available shasum256.txt.asc. can gpg verify the file has been tampered .to verify shasum256.txt.asc, will need import of gpg keys individuals authorized create releases. arelisted the bottom this readme under release team. a command such this import keys:$ gpg --keyserver pool.sks-keyservers.net --recv-keys dd8f2338bae7501e3dd5ac78c273792f7d83545d( the bottom this readme a full script import activerelease keys) can use gpg --verify shasums256.txt.asc verify thefile has been signed an authorized member the node.js team.once verified, the shasums256.txt.asc file get checksum the binary verification command above.building node.js building.md instructions how buildnode.js source. document contains list officially supported platforms.security security bugs node.js are taken seriously should reported emailing security@nodejs.org. will delivered a subset the projectteam handle security issues. please don't disclose security bugspublicly until have been handled the security team. email be acknowledged within 24 hours, youll receive moredetailed response your email within 48 hours indicating next steps handling report.current project team members node.js project team comprises group core collaborators a sub-group forms core technical committee (ctc) governs project. more information the governance the node.js project, governance.md.ctc (core technical
